body.p: A listing in this column does not preclude later review.
Atack, Iain (2012) Nonviolence in Political Theory. Edinburgh: Edinburgh University Press. vi, 202 ppp.
Bock, Joseph G (2012) The Technology of Nonviolence: Social Media and Violence Prevention. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press. xviii, 288 pp.
Chabal, Patrick (2012) The End of Conceit: Western Rationality After Postcolonialism. London: Zed. ix, 369 pp.
Conway, Daniel (2012) Masculinities, Militarisation and the End Conscription Campaign: War Resistance in Apartheid South Africa. Manchester: Manchester University Press. x, 176 pp.
Cooley, Alexander (2012) Great Games, Local Rules: The New Great Power Contest in Central Asia. New York: Oxford University Press. xiv, 252 pp.
Detraz, Nicole (2012) International Security and Gender. Cambridge: Polity. vi, 255 pp.
Dudouet, Véronique; Hans-Joachim Giessmann & Katrin Planta, eds (2012) Post-War Security Transitions: Participatory Peacebuilding After Asymmetric Conflicts. Abingdon: Routledge. xxii, 280 pp.
Faruqi, Daanish, ed. (2011) From Camp David to Cast Lead: Essays on Israel, Palestine, and the Future of the Peace Process. Lanham, MD: Lexington. xi, 173 pp.
Fixdal, Mona Christine (2012) Just Peace: How Wars Should End. New York: Palgrave Macmillan. 257 pp.
Fuhrmann, Matthew (2012) Atomic Assistance: How ‘Atoms for Peace’ Programs Cause Nuclear Insecurity. Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press. ix, 319 pp.
International Institute for Strategic Studies (IISS) (2012) Strategic Survey 2012: The Annual Review of World Affairs. London: Routledge. 416 pp.
Kadirgamar, Lakshman (2012) Democracy, Sovereignty and Terror: Lakshman Kadirgamar on the Foundations of International Order. London: IB Tauris. xviii, 264 pp.
Kaldor, Mary (2012) New and Old Wars, 3rd edn. Cambridge: Polity. xii, 268 pp.
Knopf, Jeffrey W, ed. (2012) Security Assurances and Nuclear Nonproliferation. Stanford, CA: Stanford Security Studies. xiv, 304 pp.
Piccone, Ted (2012) Catalysts for Change: How the UN’s Independent Experts Promote Human Rights. Washington, DC: Brookings Institution Press. xiii, 225 pp.
Sinclair, Timothy J (2012) Global Governance. Cambridge: Polity. ix, 197 pp.
Thawnghmung, Ardeth Maung (2012) The ‘Other’ Karen in Myanmar: Ethnic Minorities and the Struggle Without Arms. Lanham, MD: Lexington. xxxii, 199 pp.
Wellman, James K & Lombardi, Clark B, eds (2012) Religion and Human Security: A Global Perspective. New York: Oxford University Press. x, 332 pp.
